meanings.definition: The study or science of clouds.
meanings.sent1: In nephology, scientists learn about different types of clouds.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys nephology and often looks up at the sky to identify clouds.
meanings.sent3: The nephology class had a fun project where they made cloud shapes out of cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: Her nephology expertise was like having a map to navigate the sky.
meanings.sent5: Through nephology, he could predict the weather based on cloud formations.

meanings.definition: The observation and classification of clouds.
meanings.sent1: Nephology involves looking at clouds and putting them into categories.
meanings.sent2: During the nephology workshop, participants learned how to identify different cloud types.
meanings.sent3: The nephology competition awarded a prize to the person who could spot the most unique cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her nephology skills were so sharp, she could tell the type of cloud just by looking at it.
meanings.sent5: His passion for nephology led him to create a cloud identification guide for beginners.

meanings.definition: The branch of meteorology that deals with clouds.
meanings.sent1: Nephology is an important part of meteorology that focuses on clouds.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists use nephology to understand how clouds impact weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The nephology department at the university hosted a cloud-watching event for students.
meanings.sent4: Her expertise in nephology made her a valuable asset to the meteorology team.
meanings.sent5: Through nephology, scientists can better predict rain by studying cloud movements.
